channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024010666
item.description:
Report X-2024010666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found a hazmat leaker at door 311. Hazmat tote, hazmat bag and gloves were used to detain the hazmat and bring it back to QA area. Upon further inspection found that the cause was a crack on the Body. DescribePack: the cause was a crack on the Body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat tote, hazmat bag and gloves were used to detain the hazmat and bring it back to QA area

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO LOAD DOOR 305 FOR HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE WET. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IN QA IT WAS CONFIRMED THE CAPS WERE LOOSE AND CONTENTS LEAKED TO OUTER PACKAGING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACAKGE WAS CONTAINED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND REPORTS WERE FILED.

item.title: Report X-2024010673
item.description:
Report X-2024010673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to door 15 on the unload for a leaking hazmat. QA brought a hazmat tote, hazmat bag and gloves to the door and quickly detained it and brought it back to QA area. hazmat was inspected to find that there was a crack on bottom of the hazmat that was the cause of the spillage. DescribePack: hazmat was inspected to find that there was a crack on bottom of the hazmat that was the cause of the spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was put in a tote to contain it from leaking further until placed in a hazmat drum in a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024010514
item.description:
Report X-2024010514

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: FARMINGVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY ONE POUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO HIV RAPID CONTROL PACKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. OUTER BOX HAS A GREEN STICKER APPLIED "REFRIGERATE CONTROLS UPON ARRIVAL". THE BOX IS A ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER BOX PREPRINTED RUSH AND PERISHABLE WITH ORIENTATION UP ARROWS. A PACKING LIST IS IN A POUCH ON THE SIDE OF THE BOX AND DOES INDICATE THE CONTENTS HIV RAPID CONTROL PACK AND "SHIP WITH DRY ICE AND STORE AT 2-8 C UPON ARRIVAL". DUE TO THE FOLDING PATTERN THE DRY ICE INFORMATION SHOWING UNDER THE STORAGE COLUMN ON THE PACKING LIST WAS NOT VISIBLE. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER FOR FLIGHT BUT WAS NOT FLOWN.

item.title: Report X-2024010635
item.description:
Report X-2024010635

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler was unloading a trailer and noticed a hole in the top of the package. He alerted his manager who contacted the hazmat team. No other package was affected by the spill that was cleaned up in the trailer as everything was placed into a hazmat bag then into a yellow hazmat drum into the hazmat cage under ventilation. DescribePack: There is a puncture hole in the top of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a blue hazmat bag into a yellow drum and placed under ventilation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager on old unload called QA to door 22 for a leaking hazmat. QA quickly responded by bringing a hazmat tote with a hazmat bag inside while wearing gloves and was able to quickly detain it and bring it to QA area for further processing DescribePack: the body cracked on the bottom DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA quickly responded by bringing a hazmat tote with a hazmat bag inside while wearing gloves and was able to quickly detain it

item.title: Report E-2024010392
item.description:
Report E-2024010392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GLENVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling on Maple Avenue in Glenville, New York and struck a railroad bridge. The impact resulted in a large fire that consumed both the tractor and trailer along with most of the compressed natural gas being held in cylinders on the trailer. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and is handling the remediation.
